title: MEZ Authority Registry Verifiable Credential
description: A Verifiable Credential that lists authorized authority DIDs (zone authorities, legal authorities, auditors, watchers, etc.) and the attestation kinds they are permitted to sign. This is intended to provide an out-of-band root-of-trust layer to mitigate trust-anchor circularity. v0.4.15 adds optional hierarchical chaining (treaty → national → zone) via parent_registry_ref.

registry_id.description: A stable identifier for this registry snapshot.

registry_level.description: Optional hint about the delegation level (non-normative).

parent_registry_ref.description: Optional reference to a parent Authority Registry VC for hierarchical delegation (treaty → national → zone). If present, verifiers SHOULD validate that the issuer of this registry is authorized by the parent registry for the 'authority_registry' attestation kind (or '*').

as_of_date.description: Date the registry snapshot is asserted to represent (e.g., enactment as-of).

jurisdiction_id.description: Optional: the jurisdiction this registry pertains to.

zone_id.description: Optional: the zone this registry pertains to.

corridor_id.description: Optional: the corridor this registry pertains to.

did.description: Base DID for the authority (no fragment).

allowed_attestations.description: Attestation kinds the authority may sign. Use '*' to denote any. Use 'authority_registry' to authorize issuance of child registry VCs.

evidence.description: Optional evidence artifacts supporting the authority claim (appointment letters, gazette notices, etc.).
